title: SQL / LINQ Queries
subtitle: A collection of examples that demonstrate Language Integrated Query (LINQ) in C#.
description: Language Integrated Query (LINQ) is a Microsoft .NET Framework component that adds language-level data querying capabilities.
description2: The purpose of this project is to demonstrate the use of LINQ in C# by querying data from a Microsoft's 'Northwind' sample database. The project includes a WPF application that allows the user to query data from a SQLite database (and a SQL Server database if you decide to configure it that way).
description3: Alternatively, the project can be used as a template for any C# WPF application where you plan to use LINQ as it is structured in a way that allows for easy modification and configuration.

title: Chess
subtitle: A chess engine written in C#. It includes sample applications.
description: This project contains a chess engine written in C# that has all of the features to play a full game of chess. I began developing this as a school project which I eventually presented in my final year.
description2: The pieces are abstracted into their own classes with their own unique movement logic. The board is a 2d array of pieces and is responsible for validating moves, checking for checkmate, and other game-related logic.
description3: Even though the project is essentially complete, I still continue to work on it and add new features as I find it to be a great way to learn new things. The project includes a console application and desktop application with UDP multiplayer capabilities.

title: market.io
subtitle: A web platform where users can buy and list items, real estate, jobs, etc.
description: See the Github repository for a detailed overview of this project.

title: PWS Company Website
subtitle: ReactJS website for a renovation company. Hosted on AWS.
description: A professional website for a renovation company in Edmonton, Alberta. The website is build with ReactJS and hosted on AWS Amplify. I chose to use TypeScript because it simply makes web development more enjoyable and easier to debug (in my opinion). I handled all the domain and hosting configurations for the client as well.
description2: React being a stateful component-based framework, allowed me to implement interactive features the client requested. Whenever a service is clicked, a modal will show up with scrollable images, each having a brief description. Also, there is a contact form that allows users to send messages to the company email address, which is handled by the EmailJS API. From there, the company can respond to the user's message to further speak about their business.
description3: The site is styled with Tailwind CSS, which is a flexible CSS framework that allows more freedom than Bootstrap. It is very easy to use and helps speed up the time-consuming aspect of webpage styling. The site is also responsive and looks great on all devices. Because the site is hosted using AWS Amplify, it is very easy to update and maintain the site. All you essentially need to do is push to the main branch and Amplify will automatically build and deploy to the live site.
